intro: Luma planipes, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in coastal and lowland areas with well-drained soil. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Luma planipes plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is also valued for its ornamental beauty.
